article.title: Out of the Dinosaurus; the evaluation of the National Lending Library forScience and Technology
article.author: Houghton, B.
article.text: The establishment of the National Lending Library for Science and Technology (NLL) has been one of the most significant events in British librarianship in the twentieth century. This book attempts to trace the development of the library up to its merger into the impending British Library, and to describe the philosophies which shaped its policies and services. I hope that the book will be of value to British and overseas librarians as a case study of the development of a national library, and also to students of librarianship and information work in that it may help them to appreciate the context in which the library has evolved and in which it now operates.
